notes.text:
This update for xerces-c fixes the following security issue:

- CVE-2016-0729: Fixed mishandling certain kinds of malformed input documents,
  that resulted in buffer overlows during processing and error reporting.
  The overflows can manifest as a segmentation fault or as memory
  corruption during a parse operation. (bsc#966822)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: Multiple buffer overflows in (1) internal/XMLReader.cpp, (2) util/XMLURL.cpp, and (3) util/XMLUri.cpp in the XML Parser library in Apache Xerces-C before 3.1.3 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault or memory corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted document.
